results.title: A Practical guide to propagation
results.creator_credit: Celia Sullivan, Gary Johnston, Royal Horticultural Society (Great Britain) and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Horticultural Society practical guides”.
Propagation is a way of allowing you to introduce a wide variety of plants into your garden whilst at the same time providing a cost-benefit and sense of achievement with the results. This excellent two-part program filmed at the Royal Horticultural Society’s garden at Wisley and presented by an expert team of RHS gardeners demonstrates the various techniques involved in propagating, beginning with seed sowing, and followed by division, layering, cuttings, budding and grafting, and chipping and scaling. Close-up photography and detailed step-by-step instructions covering a large cross-section of plants, choice of equipment, plus lots of useful tips and ideas make this video an ideal choice for gardeners at all levels. Presented by Anne Swithinbank.

results.title: A Practical guide to herbs
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston, Charles Mills, Charles Wace, Royal Horticultural Society (Great Britain) and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Horticultural Society practical guides”.
Presented by Jekka McVicar, this detailed Royal Horticultural Society documentary offers a practical approach to the cultivation and use of herbs for both culinary and medicinal purposes. Beginning with a brief definition and history of herbs, the program goes on to provide detailed information on the creation of a herb garden, focusing on garden design, successful propagation using a variety of techniques, pruning, protecting, harvesting and drying. McVicar’s enthusiasm for her subject is apparent as she leads the viewer on a visual odyssey through the world of herbs, sharing tips and anecdotes along the way. Examples of exceptional herb gardens, such as Rosemary Verey’s Barnsley House and Raymond Blanc’s garden at Le Manoir aux Quat’Saisons are also shown, as are herb borders and other types of container, formal, and knot gardens.

results.title: A Practical guide to Europe
results.brief_description: A practical guide for people intending to travel to Europe. Provides advice on accommodation, public transport, food and cultural institutions in the major European cities. Hosted by John Guerrasio.

results.title: A Potter's world
results.brief_description: The craftsmanship of Bernard Leach who, after a number of years in the East, established a pottery in Cornwall. The influence of the Orient on his work is indicated.

results.title: A Pot of message
results.brief_description: Argues that Australians eat and drink too much and do not exercise enough. Because much of modern food is highly refined it lacks basic nutrition. Although there is a growing awareness of the need to eat more natural food it must be remembered that health foods and vitamin pills are not really the answer.

results.title: A Positive approach to the psychiatric patient
results.brief_description: Shows the treatment in Veterans Administration hospital for psychiatric patients who have emerged from acute episodes of mental illness but who are not yet well enough to leave the hospital. Uses a hospital ward unit as the focal setting, and stresses the roles of the nurse aide and physician.

results.title: A Positive Approach
results.brief_description: People who are coming to terms with being HIV positive or who have AIDS have to face a number of issues at a time when they may be feeling disoriented and vulnerable. This video is aimed at both volunteers and professionals such as social and health workers, volunteer support groups, counsellors, nurses, doctors and prison officers who offer help and support. The program is in four sections: The needs of the person with AIDS; self preparation of the carer/ counsellor; counselling skills; support for the carer/counsellor.

results.title: A Portrait of Trinidad
results.creator_credit: Victor M. Gover, County Films Ltd and W. A. Lee
results.brief_description: Trinidad on the threshold of independence. Among her thriving industries shows oil, asphalt, ad cigarettes in production. Progress in agriculture, transport, and communications, health and education, are also described. Carnival scenes capture the charm and gaiety of the Caribbean island.

results.title: A Portrait of the artist as a young man
results.creator_credit: Ulysses Film Production and Joseph Strick
results.brief_description: This magnificent adaption of James Joyce’s autobiographical novel is a faithful portrait of the young author and his coming-of-age. It portrays Stephen Dedalus and his Irish Catholic upbringing, his confrontation with the tyranny of the Church and his sexual guilt and frustration which start him on the path of rebellion. The young artist chooses lonely exile in his search for freedom and truth. Starring Bosco Hogan, T.P. McKenna and John Gielgud.
